title: Looking for a digitised version of Chambord by Foundry Olive
content: Does a digital version of this font exist anywhere in regular/bold/italics?
author: cool_hand

comments.content:
No.  
But here you can find pointers to some alternatives:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/75590](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034739/http:/typophile.com/node/75590 "http://typophile.com/node/75590")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/77996#comment-447478](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034739/http:/typophile.com/node/77996#comment-447478 "http://typophile.com/node/77996#comment-447478")
"A Book of Type and Design" by Oldrich Hlavsa,Tudor Publishing, NY 1960 has a specimen on pages 256 and 267 (Regular and Bold - caps, lowercase and numbers)

Also in Jaspert's \_Type Encyclopedia (1970)\_ at page 259. Medium, Italic, semi-bold, and condensed. All showing UC, LC & numbers.  
Don
